pr_title: [ML] Check and install the latest template in the DFA executor

timeline.bodyText: Is this sufficient to mark the task as failed? Is there any other clean up to do?
timeline.author: davidkyle

replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: I am not sold on this. Since INFERENCE_TEMPLATE is public and static, I am wondering if TransportStartDataFrameAnalyticsAction.TaskExecutor.java has a static array that it creates of all the templates it cares about.
timeline.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText:
TaskExecutor has just 1 template it cares about today. If I use an array I have to iterate that array using call backs in each put request this harms readability and is confusing as there is no requirement for that code today. If in future multiple templates need to be Put the change can be made then.
Using a static reference is fine but it would have to be initialised from the static member in MlIndexTemplateRegistry meaning this class would have to 'know' about the template registry as well as IndexTemplateConfig.
replies.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText:
meaning this class would have to 'know' about the template registry as well as IndexTemplateConfig

Its just a class path. If you would rather extract the template configs to another class, then thats fine too.
The complexity of multiple action listeners is assuaged by org.elasticsearch.action.support.GroupedActionListener.
I won't "die on this hill", but I do think adding a parameter here doesn't really make sense.
replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou

timeline.bodyText: Should we make this a warn? If it's an error I would expect it causes listener.onFailure to fire.
timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou

replies.bodyText:
It is consistent with IndexTemplateRegistry

  
    
      elasticsearch/x-pack/plugin/core/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/xpack/core/template/IndexTemplateRegistry.java
    
    
         Line 303
      in
      3b68df2
    
    
    
    

        
          
           logger.error("error adding legacy template [{}] for [{}], request was not acknowledged", 
        
    
  


TBH I wasn't sure what it would mean if isAcknowledged == false but I agree it makes more sense as a warning so I've changed it to warning.
Looking at the put template code the response cannot be false but that might change

  
    
      elasticsearch/server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/cluster/metadata/MetadataIndexTemplateService.java
    
    
         Line 763
      in
      261250d
    
    
    
    

        
          
           listener.onResponse(new PutResponse(true));
replies.author: davidkyle

timeline.author: przemekwitek

timeline.bodyText:
Could add the following line here?
inOrder.verifyNoMoreInteractions();
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText: Good point. There is an After method which calls verifyNoMoreInteractions on the mocks but you couldn't have known that from the diff
replies.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText: Actually, I should have known since I wrote the method ;) I just forgot about it :/
replies.author: przemekwitek

timeline.message: Check and install the latest template in the DFA executor
Mark as failed if put template fails
